option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/KUSUMA/Downloads/javafx_school_management_system":"{\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/SignUpController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java controller class for a sign-up functionality in a school management application.\\n\\n`SignUpController`: This class handles the sign-up process for the school management application, including input validation, user creation, and navigation to the login screen.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function initializes the application context, the users DAO, and sets up the input field validators.\\n\\n`validators()`: This function sets up the required field and number validators for the input fields.\\n\\n`makeStageDraggable()`: This function makes the main pane of the application window draggable.\\n\\n`handleKeyPressed(KeyEvent)`: This function handles the \\\"Enter\\\" key press event and calls the `handleSignUpBtn(ActionEvent)` function.\\n\\n`handleLoginBtn(ActionEvent)`: This function handles the click event of the login button and navigates the user to the login screen.\\n\\n`viewHandler(ActionEvent)`: This function loads the login FXML file and sets the scene for the stage.\\n\\n`handleSignUpBtn(ActionEvent)`: This function handles the click event of the sign-up button, validates the input fields, creates a new user, and navigates the user to the login screen.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/RecursiveStudent.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `RecursiveStudent`, which extends the `RecursiveTreeObject` class from the `com.jfoenix.controls.datamodels.treetable` package.\\n\\n`RecursiveStudent`: A class that represents a student with an ID, name, and course enrolled, and provides properties and methods to access and modify these values.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the student\\u0027s ID.\\n`setId(String id)`: Sets the student\\u0027s ID.\\n`idProperty()`: Returns the ID property of the student.\\n`getStudentName()`: Returns the student\\u0027s name.\\n`setStudentName(String studentName)`: Sets the student\\u0027s name.\\n`studentNameProperty()`: Returns the student name property.\\n`getCourseEnrolled()`: Returns the course the student is enrolled in.\\n`setCourseEnrolled(String courseEnrolled)`: Sets the course the student is enrolled in.\\n`courseEnrolledProperty()`: Returns the course enrolled property.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/ViewStudentsController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java controller class for a school management system. It handles the functionality of viewing and managing student information. Here are the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`ViewStudentsController`: This class is responsible for managing the user interface and functionality related to viewing and managing student information.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function initializes the controller, sets up the table view, and handles the selection event for the tree table view.\\n\\n`treeTableEventHandler()`: This function sets up the event handler for the tree table view, which updates the details of the selected student.\\n\\n`setDetails()`: This function sets the details of the selected student in the user interface.\\n\\n`setTable()`: This function sets up the tree table view with the student data and adds a search functionality.\\n\\n`onRefresh()`: This function refreshes the tree table view with the latest student data.\\n\\n`onEdit()`: This function handles the edit functionality for a selected student, but it currently only displays a message indicating that the feature is not implemented.\\n\\n`onDelete()`: This function handles the deletion of a selected student, displaying a confirmation dialog and removing the student from the system.\\n\\n`removeItem()`: This function removes the selected student from the system and updates the tree table view.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/FxmlHandlers.kt\":\"This file appears to be a utility class for handling FXML (JavaFX Markup Language) related tasks. It contains a single object, `FxmlHandlers`, which provides a function for animating the loading of FXML content.\\n\\n`FxmlHandlers`: A utility object that provides functions for handling FXML-related tasks.\\n\\n`animatedFxmlLoader`: A function that loads an FXML pane and animates its appearance on the scene.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/resource/css/styles..css\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. The document appears to be an empty XML document with a `\\u003cdocument\\u003e` and `\\u003c/document\\u003e` tag, but no content within it.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/Test.kt\":\"This file appears to be a Kotlin object named `Test` that serves as the main entry point for a school management application. It does not contain any classes, but it does have several functions that interact with various data access objects (DAOs) to perform operations related to users, students, and departments.\\n\\n`Test`: The main entry point for the school management application.\\n\\n`main`: The main function that sets up the Spring application context, retrieves the necessary DAOs, and performs various operations such as saving a department, updating a user, retrieving all students, and creating a new student.\\n\\nThe file demonstrates the usage of the school management application\\u0027s functionality, including interacting with the `UsersDao`, `StudentsDao`, and `DepartmentsDao` to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on the corresponding entities.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/dao/Dao.kt\":\"This file contains a single class `Dao` and one function `setJdbcTemplate`.\\n\\n`Dao`: This class serves as a data access object (DAO) for a school management system, providing a way to interact with the database using the Spring JDBC template.\\n\\n`setJdbcTemplate`: This function sets the `JdbcTemplate` instance that the `Dao` class will use to interact with the database.\",\"/db backup/studentapp.sql\":\"This file appears to be a SQL script for creating and populating a database for a student application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the structure and data for the following tables:\\n\\n`departments`: Stores the list of departments available in the application.\\n`students`: Stores the student information, including their personal details, registration details, and financial information.\\n`users`: Stores the user information, including their login credentials and roles (admin, staff).\\nThe script also includes the necessary SQL statements to create the tables, insert sample data, and set up the primary keys and foreign key relationships between the tables.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/models/Users.kt\":\"`Users`: A class that represents a user in a school management system, with properties such as ID, username, first name, last name, email, mobile number, role, and password.\\n\\n`toString()`: A function that returns a string representation of the `Users` object, including all its properties.\\n\\nThis file defines a `Users` class that represents a user in a school management system. The class has properties for storing the user\\u0027s ID, username, first name, last name, email, mobile number, role, and password. The class also includes a constructor and a `toString()` method to provide a string representation of the object.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/main/Launcher.kt\":\"This file appears to be a Kotlin class that extends the `Application` class from the JavaFX library. It is responsible for launching the main application window and setting up the Spring application context.\\n\\n`Launcher`: This class is the main entry point for the application and is responsible for loading the FXML file, creating the scene, and displaying the primary stage.\\n\\n`start(primaryStage: Stage)`: This function is overridden from the `Application` class and is responsible for loading the FXML file, creating the scene, and displaying the primary stage.\\n\\n`init()`: This function is overridden from the `Application` class and is responsible for initializing the Spring application context and retrieving a list of users from the `UsersDao` bean.\\n\\n`stop()`: This function is overridden from the `Application` class and is responsible for closing the Spring application context when the application is stopped.\\n\\n`main(args: Array\\u003cString\\u003e)`: This is the main entry point for the application, which calls the `launch()` function to start the `Launcher` class.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/resource/css/jfoenix-main-demo.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for various UI elements in a JavaFX application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual appearance and behavior of the following UI components:\\n\\n`.tree-table-view`: Styles the appearance of a tree table view, including the selected row and cell styles.\\n\\n`.jfx-hamburger`: Styles the appearance of a hamburger menu icon.\\n\\n`.dial-btn`: Styles the appearance of a dial button.\\n\\n`.deptField`: Styles the appearance of a text field with a floating label.\\n\\n`.gender-radio`: Styles the appearance of a radio button for gender selection.\\n\\nThe file provides a consistent and customized look and feel for the application\\u0027s UI elements.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/Alerts.kt\":\"This file contains a Kotlin object named `Alerts` that provides utility functions for displaying JFX alerts and blurred alerts in a JavaFX application.\\n\\n`Alerts`: This object provides utility functions for displaying JFX alerts and blurred alerts.\\n\\n`jfxAlert`: This function creates a JFX alert with a title, body, and a close button that hides the alert when clicked or when the Enter key is pressed.\\n\\n`jfxBluredAlert`: This function creates a JFX alert with a title, body, and a close button that hides the alert and removes the blur effect from the specified node when clicked or when the Enter key is pressed.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/SideNavController.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SideNavController`, which is responsible for managing the side navigation pane of a school management application.\\n\\n`SideNavController`: This class handles the initialization and event handling for the side navigation pane, which includes buttons for navigating to the home, add, and view student pages.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function loads the FXML files for the home, add, and view student pages, and sets up the event handlers for the navigation buttons.\\n\\n`homeController()`: This function is responsible for animating the FXML loader when the home button is clicked.\\n\\n`handlers()`: This function sets up the event handlers for the navigation buttons, calling the `animatedFxmlLoader()` function from the `FxmlHandlers` utility class to load the appropriate FXML file and animate the transition.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/dao/UsersDao.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `UsersDao`, which provides data access operations for the `Users` model in a school management system.\\n\\n`UsersDao`: A class that provides data access operations for the `Users` model, including checking if a user exists, updating user information, retrieving all users, saving a new user, and getting a user by username.\\n\\n`setJdbcTemplate`: A function that sets the `JdbcTemplate` object used for database operations.\\n`userExist`: A function that checks if a user with the given username and password exists in the database.\\n`updateUser`: A function that updates the user information for the given username.\\n`allUsers`: A property that retrieves a list of all users from the database.\\n`saveUser`: A function that saves a new user to the database.\\n`getUser`: A function that retrieves a user by their username from the database.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/Validators.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but it does contain the following functions:\\n\\n`isValidEmail`: Checks if the given string is a valid email address using a regular expression pattern.\\n\\n`isNumber`: Checks if the given string is a valid number by iterating through each character and ensuring they are all digits.\\n\\nThis file is a utility class that provides two validation functions: one for checking if a string is a valid email address, and another for checking if a string is a valid number.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/dao/StudentsDao.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `StudentsDao`, which provides data access functionality for managing student records in a school management system.\\n\\n`StudentsDao`: This class is responsible for interacting with the database to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on student records.\\n\\n`setJdbcTemplate`: This function sets the `JdbcTemplate` object used for database interactions.\\n\\n`totalReg`: This function returns the total number of registered students.\\n\\n`totalMales`: This function returns the total number of male students.\\n\\n`totalFemales`: This function returns the total number of female students.\\n\\n`allStudents`: This property returns a list of all students.\\n\\n`saveStudent`: This function saves a new student record to the database.\\n\\n`getStudent`: This function retrieves a student record by their ID.\\n\\n`deleteStudent`: This function deletes a student record by their ID.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/dao/DepartmentsDao.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `DepartmentsDao`, which provides data access functionality for the `Departments` model in a school management application.\\n\\n`DepartmentsDao`: This class is responsible for interacting with the database to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on the `Departments` data.\\n\\n`setJdbcTemplate`: This function sets the `JdbcTemplate` instance used by the `DepartmentsDao` class to interact with the database.\\n\\n`departments`: This property retrieves a list of all the departments stored in the database.\\n\\n`deleteDepartment`: This function deletes a department from the database based on the provided department name.\\n\\n`saveDepartment`: This function saves a new department to the database with the provided department name.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/Formatter.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`dateTimeFormatOfNow()`: This function returns the current date and time in the format \\\"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss\\\".\\n\\nThe file appears to be a utility class that provides a function to format the current date and time in a specific format.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/Main.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it serves as an entry point for the `schoolmanagement` application, which is likely a larger project. The `Main` object acts as a wrapper for the `Launcher` class, which is responsible for starting the application.\\n\\nThe file can be summarized as follows:\\n\\nThe `Main` object provides a `main` function that calls the `main` function of the `Launcher` class, which is the entry point for the `schoolmanagement` application.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/models/Departments.kt\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`Departments`: A class that represents a department in a school management system, with properties for the department ID and name.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, only the class definition.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/AddStudentController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java controller class for a school management system. It handles the functionality of adding a new student to the system. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`AddStudentController`: This class is responsible for managing the user interface and logic for adding a new student to the school management system.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function initializes the necessary dependencies and sets the initial values for the form fields.\\n\\n`setValues()`: This function sets the initial values for the form fields, such as the registration date and the list of departments.\\n\\n`onClear()`: This function clears all the form fields and resets the values to their default state.\\n\\n`onSave()`: This function handles the validation of the form fields and saves the new student data to the database.\\n\\n`students()`: This function creates a new `Students` object with the data entered in the form fields.\\n\\n`calculateAmount()`: This function calculates the remaining balance based on the entered course amount.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/models/Students.kt\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`Students`: A class that represents a student in a school management system, with properties such as name, contact information, enrollment details, and financial information.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but the `toString()` method is overridden to provide a string representation of the `Students` class.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/RecursiveUser.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`RecursiveUser`: A class that extends `RecursiveTreeObject` and represents a user with a username and email.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`getUserName()`: Returns the username of the user.\\n`setUserName(String userName)`: Sets the username of the user.\\n`userNameProperty()`: Returns the `StringProperty` representing the username of the user.\\n`getEmail()`: Returns the email of the user.\\n`setEmail(String email)`: Sets the email of the user.\\n`emailProperty()`: Returns the `StringProperty` representing the email of the user.\\n\\nThis file defines a custom `RecursiveUser` class that extends `RecursiveTreeObject` and provides methods to access and modify the username and email properties of the user.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/HomeController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java class named `HomeController` that is part of a school management system. It contains several functions that handle the user interface and data management for the application. Here is a list of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`HomeController`: This class is responsible for managing the home page of the school management system.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function initializes the application context, sets up the table view, and populates the departments list.\\n\\n`setTable()`: This function sets up the table view with user data and adds a search functionality.\\n\\n`departmentsList()`: This function populates the departments list view with the available departments.\\n\\n`setLabels()`: This function sets the values of various labels on the home page based on the user data.\\n\\n`onEditUser()`: This function opens a dialog box to allow the user to edit their personal information.\\n\\n`onAddDepartment()`: This function opens a dialog box to allow the user to add a new department.\\n\\n`refreshDept(ActionEvent event)`: This function refreshes the departments list.\\n\\n`deleteDept(ActionEvent event)`: This function deletes a selected department.\\n\\n`onRefresh()`: This function refreshes the user table view.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/utils/Directories.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a set of constant values that represent the file paths for various FXML and configuration files used in the School Management application. These constants are likely used throughout the application to easily reference the locations of these files.\\n\\nThe file serves as a centralized location for storing and managing the file paths used in the application, which can help maintain consistency and make it easier to update file locations if needed.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/PopUpController.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `PopUpController`, which handles the functionality of a pop-up window in a school management application.\\n\\n`PopUpController`: This class handles the functionality of a pop-up window, including the ability to exit the application and log out the user.\\n\\n`exitHandler()`: This function is responsible for exiting the application when the user chooses to do so.\\n\\n`logoutHandler(ActionEvent event)`: This function is responsible for logging out the user and transitioning to the login screen when the user chooses to log out.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/LoginController.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LoginController`, which is responsible for handling the login functionality of a school management application.\\n\\n`LoginController`: This class manages the login process, including validating user input, authenticating users, and transitioning to the main application window.\\n\\n`getInstance()`: This method returns the singleton instance of the `LoginController` class.\\n\\n`getUsername()`: This method returns the username entered by the user in the login form.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This method is called when the `LoginController` is initialized, and it sets up the application context, the `UsersDao` instance, and the input field validators.\\n\\n`validators()`: This method sets up the required field validators for the username and password input fields.\\n\\n`makeStageDraggable()`: This method makes the login window draggable by the user.\\n\\n`handleKeyPressed(KeyEvent)`: This method handles the user pressing the \\\"Enter\\\" key, which triggers the login process.\\n\\n`handleLoginBtn(ActionEvent)`: This method handles the user clicking the login button, validating the input fields, and authenticating the user. If the login is successful, it transitions to the main application window.\\n\\n`handleSignUpBtn(ActionEvent)`: This method handles the user clicking the sign-up button, which transitions to the sign-up window.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a documentation for a School Management System project built using JavaFX, Kotlin, and Java. It does not contain any specific class or function definitions, but rather provides an overview of the project, its features, and the libraries used.\\n\\nThe file provides the following information:\\n\\n1. Previews of the different windows and panes of the application, including the Login Window, Sign-up Window, Home Window, Side Navigation, Pop-up Menu, Add Student Pane, and View Students Pane.\\n\\n2. The project was written in Kotlin and Java, and it uses several libraries such as JavaFX, Jfoenix, Spring Framework, Apache Common Codecs, MySQL Connector 8, and Jetbrains Kotlin.\\n\\n3. The project can be run in Java 8 and future releases of Java (9-14) with the proper setup of the JavaFX SDK and VM options.\\n\\n4. The database setup instructions are provided, including the location of the backup file and the default admin credentials.\\n\\n5. The file also mentions that the project is recommended to be used with IntelliJ IDEA and that the Kotlin plugin should be installed for better development experience.\",\"/src/schoolmanagement/java/controllers/MainController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Java class named `MainController` that serves as the main controller for a JavaFX application. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`MainController`: This class is responsible for managing the main user interface of the application, including the initialization of the home page, handling of the popup menu, and the initialization of the side navigation drawer.\\n\\n`initialize()`: This function is called when the `MainController` class is initialized. It loads the home page, sets up the popup menu, initializes the side navigation drawer, and makes the stage draggable.\\n\\n`handlePopup()`: This function is responsible for loading and displaying the popup menu when the user clicks the corresponding button.\\n\\n`initDrawer()`: This function sets up the side navigation drawer, including the transition animation when the drawer is opened or closed.\\n\\n`makeStageDraggable()`: This function makes the main stage of the application draggable by the user.\"}"}
